In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code that will solve your problem:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = convert(Vector{Int64},map((dt)->Dates.year(dt)*100 + Dates.month(dt), df[:dt]))
    return df
end
```
This function adds a new column `ym` to the DataFrame that contains year and month information from `dt`. 

It uses the `map` function which applies a function elementwise to an array, in this case extracting the year and month from DateTimes. The result is then converted to an Array of integers with `convert`. 

The function uses `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` from DataFrames package to get the year and month components respectively. 

Finally, the year (`Dates.year(dt)`) and month (`Dates.month(dt)`) are concatenated together to form a new column in the format "yyyymm".
